result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford D. Jamerson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clifford D. Jamerson Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clifford D. Jamerson Jr. was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Clifford D. Jamerson Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $17.98 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with felons or drug dealers, Shopko, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not be present in any establishment in which the sale of alcohol is the primary function, maintain a stable residence, maintain sobriety.

records.addlTxt: from Jeffrey Jaeger @ DOC

Deft has successfully completed the ERP on 10/30/15.
  Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP concurrent to 14CF265 & 14CM1388; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 136 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP concurrent to ct 2 and to 14CF265 & 14CM1388; 1 year initial confinement w/credit for 136 days served; 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP.

Defendant, Clifford D. Jamerson, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Parties agree to adjourn; case will be heard with DE's other file 13CM1388. The Court authorizes Atty Koesser to receive copies of the PSIs previously filed.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 08:45 am.
